#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to read txt
line = txt.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2]

#sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln/2:]

#sets second to reversed second (slicing)
second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reversed first (slicing)
first = first[::-1]

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"

if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"

input_str = input() 

is_palindrome = True
for i in range(int(len(input_str) / 2)):
    if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]:
        is_palindrome = False

if is_palindrome:
    print('Yes')
else:
    print('No')

is_palindrome = True
for i in range(int(len(input_str) // 2)):
    if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]:
        is_palindrome = False
        break

if is_palindrome:
    print('Yes')
else:
    print('No')

input_str = input('Enter string: ')


def is_palindrome(input_str):
    is_palindrome = True
    for i in range(int(len(input_str) / 2)):
        if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]:
            is_palindrome = False
    return is_palindrome


print(is_palindrome(input_str))

        is_palindrome = False

if is_palindrome:
    print('Yes')
else:
    print('No')


#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to read txt
line = txt.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line (slicing)
first = line[:ln/2+1]

#sets second to second half of line (slicing)
second = line[ln/2:]

#sets second to reversed second
second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reversed first
first = first[::-1]

#sets middle to middle of line (slicing)
middle = line[ln/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"


input_str = input() # Ввод строки

is_palindrome = True # Присваиваем переменной значение True
for i in range(int(len(input_str) / 2)): # Обходим все элементы строки
    if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]: # Если первый элемент не равен последнему
        is_palindrome = False # Присваиваем переменной значение False

if is_palindrome:
    print('Yes')
else:
    print('No')

if input_str == input_str[::-1]:
    print('Yes')
else:

#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets f to open filename
f = open(filename)

#sets line to read f
line = f.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2]

#sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln/2+1:]

#sets second to reverse second
second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reverse first
first = first[::-1]

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"


#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to read txt
line = txt.read()

#sets line to line without newline character
line = line[:-1]

#sets ln to length of line - 1
ln = len(line) - 1

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2 + 1]

#sets second to second half of line + 1
second = line[ln/2 + 1:]

#sets second to reversed second (slicing) - 1
second = second[::-1] - 1

#sets first to reversed first (slicing)
first = first[::-1] - 1

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2] - 1

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"

#sets txt to open filename

second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reverse first
first = first[::-1]

middle = line[length/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"


#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to read txt
line = txt.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2-1]

#sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln/2:]

#sets second to reverse second
second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reverse first
first = first[::-1]

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reverse line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"


input_str = input()  # Ввод строки

is_palindrome = True  # Присваиваем переменной значение True
for i in range(int(len(input_str) / 2)):  # Обходим все элементы строки
    if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]:  # Если первый элемент не равен последнему
        is_palindrome = False  # Присваиваем переменной значение False

if is_palindrome:
    print('Yes')
else:
    print('No')


#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv 

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename) 

#sets line to read txt
line = txt.read() 

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line) 

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2] 

#sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln/2+1:] 

#sets second to reverse second
second = second[::-1] 

#sets first to reverse first
first = first[::-1] 

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2] 

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]: 
    print "Yes" 
else:
    print "No"
